channel.title: Getting Started on TLDR Dev Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on TLDR Dev Notes

item.title: Getting started with Express
item.description: Initialize the project and install and save express to package.json npm init -y npm i -S express Here’s the code for a very basic server up and running const express = require('express') const app = express() app.get('/', function (req, res) { res.send('Bonjour la monde!') }) const server = app.listen(3001, function () { console.info(`Server running at http://localhost:${server.address().port}`) }) install nodemon and add npm scripts to package.json npm i -D nodemon "scripts": { "start": "node index.

item.title: Getting started with Jekyll
item.description: installation sudo gem install jekyll jekyll new my-awesome-site cd my-awesome-site jekyll serve # watches for changes by default # => Now browse to http://localhost:4000 jekyll serve watches for changes by default. It serves the site locally on port 4000. To build the site for production, you can use the build command. jekyll build --watch configuration Links https://jekyllrb.com/ https://jekyllrb.com/docs/configuration/
